title: New mastery Expose Weakness should be swapped with Assassin
body:
As a low level play who loves playing support (just got out of bronze, Woo) I was thrilled that they added a new master to help a supportive player, but its location is in a place where full support builds (In the mastery tree) cant really reach, I personaly go 9 in the Cunning tree and 21 in the Resolve tree (there wasn't any reason to go down the Ferocity due to it being solely dps based , that was before Expose Weakness~). Expose Weakness being in the ferocity tree seams out of place and would be more fitting in the Cunning tree (it makes sense for a cunning person to expose a weakness...), and for Expose Weakness to fit into the cunning tree, assassin should be moved over to the ferocity tree. (I don't play too many assassins but I would expect they would go full dps and spec into, 21 in cunning and 9 in ferocity or the other way round), even though this would make the tier 2 masters in the ferocity tree seam  plain (A 3% bones in a given situation or a 2/3% bonus with a trade--off). 

Add a comment on your opinion if you think this should be changed too, ty for reading

replies.body:
Honestly, that would go totally against the point.
Assasin was added to the low tier cunning tree so assasins, which are supposed to go cunning due stormraiders/thunderlords, have a masteries they actually like down there.
Expose weaknesses was added to the ferocity tree so there are options for no-glasscannons. Especially for jungler and sup.
The entier idea of adding new masteies to the trees is creating diversity, giving actually a reason to decide wethere you go 9/21/0 or 0/21/9 on your sup lulu for example, or even go crazy with 21/9/0 and AA-harras the shit out of them with fervor.

One could certainly argue that the execution of that idea still is rather terrible, but the idea of haveing actually meaningfull choices instead of a cookie-cutter solution is great, and haveing exposed weaknesses and assasin located where they are is a step into the right direction.

It does feel like more a matter of execution at this point. Because there's no tier 2 Keystone supports would want in the Ferocity tree, it feels like supports options are limited to taking 6 points in that tree and 6 in another, or taking the more conventional route of going 18-12. Here's to hoping Riot adds more options to those lower tier Keystones in the future.

Perhaps the problem is merely that we need more options for those styles in those trees. Currently there's no real supportive ability in the Ferocity tree aside from the new Expose Weakness which makes which makes it seem pointless there since it's the only thing that would help a supportive oriented person.

The entire idea of these masteries was to give heroes that don't have legitimate options in that tier of keystones an option that they'd really want. Take out the new masteries from these trees for a second.

In Ferocity, you have Double-Edged sword, which makes you deal more damage, and Feast, which improves your sustain if you last hit. In Cunning, you have Runic Affinity, which increases neutral buff duration, and Secret Stash, which improves sustain by giving your champion biscuits.

Ferocity has no options for champions that don't want to deal extra damage and either don't want or can't use the sustain that Feast provides. For aggressive supports that want to run any of the Ferocity masteries, they have no good options for their tier 1 keystones. Likewise, Cunning has no options for solo laners that don't want the sustain that biscuits provide, so assassins don't have any good aggressive options in the tree.

Switch the masteries around, and suddenly there's a lot of overlap. Supports don't have the option of going into the Ferocity tree for a more aggressive playstyle while assassins get no options from the Cunning tree that they all love to spec into.

It's intended for more offensive supports - ones that wouldn't often max out their points in the resolve tree. It's where it should be.

9 in cunning and 21 in resolve?

What?  You can't do that. They max at 18.

The point is so that supports will actually have to make decisions instead of mindlessly going 0/18/12 or 0/12/18 for Bond of Stone.

Supports having no reason to go Ferocity (even burst supports like Zyra and Sona) makes the support role as a whole tankier, and that can lead to some balance issues where masteries that tanks NEED get nerfed because supports are using them. 

Enticing supports to take Ferocity (thus making them squishier by removing Resolve) is a much better way to balance.

I'll take 8% improved heals, shields, and regen or +45 flat health along with +50% always on base regen with 200% regen at 25% threshold thanks. It helps you SURVIVE those jerks packing ignites or early cheese down there. Also just general efficiency because you aren't stuck popping as many biscuits or heals to bring your HP back up to a reasonable threshold.

You can't do damage or peel when dead or so low that you may as well be dead if you walk within ~900 range of an enemy. With how stupid burst is this season there is a freaking reason everyone and their cousin in support is taking at least 12 in resolve generally.

And if you don't take those wonderful sustain/recovery options you are bound to be shoved out of lane by those who do, because they can trade and recover while you just... do not short of backing. At which point you end up behind, doubly so if they killed you.
